item.title: Report E-2024040468
item.description:
Report E-2024040468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: GLADE SPRING
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 13, 2024, at 2240 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Glade Spring, Virginia regarding the release of approximately 45 gallons of METHYL ETHYL KETONE (UN1193, 3, III) from (4) 55-gallon DMâ€™s. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by multiple pallets breaking creating punctures and was contained to the trailer floor and a 1ft x 1ft area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (1) 55-gallon DM, and the 4 damaged drums with remaining product were each placed in 85-gallon DM overpacks and was taken offsite by contractors.

item.title: Report X-2024040947
item.description:
Report X-2024040947

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 1 fiberboard box: UN1789 containing (5 fiberboard boxes) was discovered leaking on the bottom. Inner contents: 5 fiberboard boxes smaller boxes. One of the inner boxes, which was leaking, had been packed upside down (indicated by the orientation arrows on each inner box. The contents of each inner box were 1 glass bottle, held in place with Styrofoam. Remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024040761
item.description:
Report X-2024040761

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: the package was reported as damage because the box was wet, once the package was opened it was noted that the items of ethyl alcohol needed to be labeled as hazmat property, package was contained while having it process. DescribePack: one of the bottle seals was broken which contributed to the leakage. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: adding extra seals and plastic around the bottles, also ethyl alcohol is strong item for hazmat properties

item.title: Report X-2024040709
item.description:
Report X-2024040709

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Strong odor of sulfur noticed around car by Mechanical person during inspection. Car isolated and NS Haz Mat & contractor responded. Meter reading of over 90ppm were found around the base of the "Salco" style rupture disk assembly. Rupture disk and gasket were removed and replaced. Car had a lot of pressure on it and had to vent through tthe disk assembly before removal. Once reassembled, still got hit on meter. Rupture disk assembly was removed from manway cover, gasket replaced, and assembly was resecured. No reading on meter.
